ActivityTitle: Structure and Function of Animal Tissues
QuestionStem: Explore the photograph of the rat to see how the structure relates to function in tissues.

content.imageAlt: Click on this photograph of a brown rat to learn more about its tissues.

panels.title: Epithelial tissue
panels.description: Rats are omnivores and will eat almost anything they can find. The tissue that lines the rat intestine has finger-like projections that increase the surface area.
panels.imageAlt: This magnified image shows that the tissue lining a rat's intestine has a structure that is similar to fringe on the edge of a blanket.

panels.title: Nervous tissue
panels.description: Rats can remember food sources. The cells that make up the nervous tissue have long, branching extensions.
panels.imageAlt: This magnified image shows the branched structure of nerve tissue.

panels.title: Muscle tissue
panels.description: Rats have long, flexible bodies that can squeeze through small holes. The skeletal muscle tissue is made up of muscle cells organized into stretchy fibers.
panels.imageAlt: This magnified image shows the fibers that make up muscle tissue.
